item.title: Stanley Druckenmiller says 'animal spirits' are back in markets because of Trump with CEOs 'giddy'
item.description: "I'd say CEOs are somewhere between relieved and giddy. So we're a believer in animal spirits," Druckenmiller said.

item.title: Trump inauguration: Tech CEOs like Musk, Bezos and Zuckerberg score better seats than some incoming cabinet members
item.description: Companies like Amazon, Meta, Alphabet and OpenAI have donated $1 apiece to the Trump Inauguration, and their leaders are in prime spots.

item.title: ‘I’m worried about a recession once Trump takes office’: I’m 62, earn $50,000 and have $100,000 to invest. What should I do?

item.title: Is the stock market open today? Here’s what to know for Inauguration Day and MLK Day.
item.description: The two major events fall on the same day — Jan. 20 — but most closures are because of MLK Day, which is a federal holiday.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway hasn't paid a dividend in nearly 60 years — Could that ever change?
item.description: Howard Buffett, Berkshire's future nonexecutive chairman, hesitated when asked about dividends when his father Warren is no long at the helm.
